hanzi-su-wiki:
歴

Значения

Чередование; прошлое; исстари

Мнемоника

Выращивать растения 木 в тёплом месте под обрывом 厂. Элемент нога 止 подчёркивает постоянство оседлой жизни, сбор урожая на одном и том же месте. Так жили предки.

Варианты

歷, 历
purpleculture_pinyin:
lì
old variant of 歷 |历 [li4]
старый вариант календаря | календарь [li4]
rtega_mnemonic:
歴歴RStake place, past, history
  • if you stop 止 in the woods 林 at a cliff side 厂 you get a sense of geological history: how many years has it taken for the cliff to stick out of the ground?
𠩵
heisig_constituent: curriculum, cliff, grove, tree, wood, stop, footprint, tree2, wood2
heisig_story: That same grove of trees we met in frame 226 shows up here in the character for curriculum (in the sense of a record of one's life or academic achievements, the curriculum vitae). Instead of the grove making its way slowly through the surface of the cliff as before, here we see it stopped, much the same as a curriculum vitae calls a halt to the calendar and talks only about the past.
myStory: как деревья растут, остановленная идея план
koohiiStory1: A CURRICULUM is a calendar that replaces days with reasons to stop having fun.
koohiiStory2: A little like a calendar, your CV records your footsteps through time.
jp_example_words:
学歴(がくれき): academic background
経歴(けいれき): personal history, career
履歴(りれき): personal history, background, career, log
歴史(れきし): history
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You stop at a cliff with a tree on it, realizing that continuation is impossible unless you find some way to bridge the gap to the other side of the cliff. The tree seems long enough to reach to the other side, but how are you going to chop it down?
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine yourself on this cliff. You desire a continuation for your journey, not wanting to stop here. Feel the strong wind on your body, blowing your hair about as you stand on the edge of the cliff. The leaves on the tree rustle in the breeze.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Continuation is impossible unless you chop this tree down to use as a bridge to cross to the other side of the cliff. You decide to use a wrecking (れき) ball. Luckily, there’s one right by you. So you take the wrecking ball and knock the tree over, making a bridge with it.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture yourself using the wrecking ball to knock down the tree on the cliff. Hear the chug of the wrecking ball engine as the tree cracks and splinters from the force of the wrecking ball.
Ru_Notes: Значение "карьера", которое предлагает Яркси, не особо правильно.
Ru_Words:
歴れき
  • история, опыт чего-либо
    • 歴史れきし
  • история, чьё-либо прошлое
    • 歴代れきだい
  • поколения
    • 経歴けいれき
  • биография, служебный стаж
    • 学歴がくれき
  • пройденный курс обучения, полученное образование, образовательный ценз
    • warodai
Ru_Radicals: 厂 (скала), 广 (скала с точкой), 木 (дерево), 止 (останавливать), 麻 (конопля)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you can't stop (止) the flax (麻) of time

歴字的基本解释

歴
lì
古同“历”。

歴字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lì］
［《廣韻》郎擊切，入錫，來。］
亦作“厤1”。亦作“歴1”。“历1”的繁体字。
(1)经历；经过。指时间上的。
(2)经历；经过。指空间上的。
(3)行；游历。
(4)越过。
(5)遭逢；经受。
(6)依照次序。
(7)谓先后担任各种官职。
(8)指担任。
(9)多；曾经多次。
(10)尽；遍。
(11)长久。
(12)发出；流露。
(13)审视；察看。
(14)选择。
(15)犹离。分别。
(16)清楚。
(17)稀疏。
(18)乱，紊乱。
(19)引申为扰乱，触犯。
(20)炼。
(21)“手歷”或“歷頭”的省称。宋代的一种赋税凭证。
(22)同“曆”。历法。
(23)同“曆”。指善于历算的人。
(24)同“曆”。指记载年月日节气的书册。
(25)同“曆”。历数，气数。
(26)“靂”的古字。
(27)通“瀝”。清酒。
(28)通“櫪”。拶指。古代刑罚。参见“歷指”。
(29)通“櫪

歴
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［lì］
["Guangyun" Lang hits and cuts, enters the tin, come. ]
Also known as "Calendar 1". Also known as "歴1". Traditional characters of "历1".
(1) Experience; after. Refers to time.
(2) Experience; after. Refers to spatially.
(3) Line; travel.
(4) Cross over.
(5) Meet; endure.
(6) According to the order.
(7) Said that he successively held various official positions.
(8) Refers to serving.
(9) Many; once many times.
(10) Exhaust; times.
(11) Long-term.
(12) Issued; revealed.
(13) Inspect; inspect.
(14) Choice.
(15) Youli. respectively.
(16) Clear.
(17) Sparse.
(18) Chaos, disorder.
(19) The extension is disturbing, offending.
(20) Refining.
(21) The provincial name of "hand calendar" or "litou". A tax voucher in the Song Dynasty.
(22) Same as "calendar". Calendar.
(23) Same as "calendar". Refers to people who are good at calendars.
(24) Same as "calendar". Refers to a book that records the solar terms of the year, month, and day.
(25) Same as "calendar". The number of calendars, the number of breaths.
(26) The ancient word for "Li".
(27) Through "Li". Sake.
(28) Through "枥".拶指. Ancient punishment. See "calendar".
(29) To

Radicals: 厂, 木, 止  (cliff, tree, stop)
Meaning Mnemonic
You stop at a cliff with a tree on it, realizing that continuation is impossible unless you find some way to bridge the gap to the other side of the cliff. The tree seems long enough to reach to the other side, but how are you going to chop it down?
Imagine yourself on this cliff. You desire a continuation for your journey, not wanting to stop here. Feel the strong wind on your body, blowing your hair about as you stand on the edge of the cliff. The leaves on the tree rustle in the breeze.
Reading Mnemonic
Continuation is impossible unless you chop this tree down to use as a bridge to cross to the other side of the cliff. You decide to use a wrecking (れき) ball. Luckily, there’s one right by you. So you take the wrecking ball and knock the tree over, making a bridge with it.
Picture yourself using the wrecking ball to knock down the tree on the cliff. Hear the chug of the wrecking ball engine as the tree cracks and splinters from the force of the wrecking ball.
